snippet: The Mets will have a fighting chance to keep Cespedes, which did not appear to be the case until Tuesday, when it was disclosed that the five-day provision in his current contract had been waived.
abstract: New York Mets and outfielder Yoenis Cespedes agree to remove clause in Cespedes' original contract that would have given team only five days to re-sign him when his contract expires after World Series; Mets are now able to negotiate with Cespedes throughout entire free-agency period.
lead_paragraph: The Mets will have a fighting chance to keep Cespedes, which did not appear to be the case until Tuesday, when it was disclosed that the five-day provision in his current contract had been waived.

headline.main: The Window for the Mets to Keep Yoenis Cespedes Is Opened Wide
headline.print_headline: The Window for the Mets to Keep Cespedes Is Opened Wide
